intro: Androsace salicifolia, commonly known as the willowleaf sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth habit. The plant features small, opposite leaves that are lanceolate and often covered with a fine layer of white hairs. Its flowers are typically pink or white, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems, and bloom in early summer. Androsace salicifolia thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments.
